intro: Aster lepidophyllus, commonly known as the ice plant, is a unique succulent native to the arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing stems and leaves that often appear shriveled when dry. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it well-adapted to harsh desert environments. Its ability to store water in its stems allows it to survive prolonged droughts.
